body_text:
I don't love this string manipulation, but I get it. I'm actually surprised eslint didn't complain about +=ing the string.
In general, I think we should work with the router's values if we have to mess with URLs. Hardcoding the routes feels sketchy.
body:
I don't love this string manipulation, but I get it. I'm actually surprised eslint didn't complain about `+=`ing the string.

In general, I think we should work with the `router`'s values if we have to mess with URLs. Hardcoding the routes feels sketchy.
body_html:
I don't love this string manipulation, but I get it. I'm actually surprised eslint didn't complain about +=ing the string.

In general, I think we should work with the router's values if we have to mess with URLs. Hardcoding the routes feels sketchy.
